I started escitalopram 10mg a little while ago, and I take DPH pretty often, doses ranging from 150-300mg on average. This week I did DPH almost daily (just taking a random number of pills oh god) mixed with some DXM, and I‚Äôve been fine so far. Not dead. If you do notice anything, let me know though. Good luck.

After long term restriction, delayed stomach emptying can occur which can make digestive wackyyyy. Especially combined with purging or chew/spit. It can definitely be beneficial to look into seeing a gastroenterologist if it starts to really bother you or get painful, etc. But yeah, wacky digestive stuff really suck, sorry :(

The problem with chew/spit is that it gets addictive. You can‚Äôt stop after you start doing it. The act of chewing the food causes your body to release digestive enzymes and begin to digest the food that you‚Äôre eating, but if you‚Äôre not actually swallowing it, it‚Äôs going to cause A LOT of digestive issues. It can ruin your teeth, destroy your stomach and wreck your body pretty badly once the addiction gets severe. I know it sounds super tempting to just do it once, but it‚Äôs never just that one time. You won‚Äôt gain weight just this once, but the long term effect will haunt you. Just think wisely, okay?

Just take a deep breath. I kinda ended up in a bit of a bind (you tell them, or I will) and I spent the whole day crying about it, but I just said screw it, and sat down with my dad and explained everything. He seemed to appreciate hearing it from me, instead of a third party. Being able to have that deep, personal connection with your parents can make it a lot easier for both of you, instead of getting a phone call from your school. Just something to think about, let me know how it goes :))

Literally all she said was that she didn‚Äôt like her body and I tried to suck her into this world. I didn‚Äôt even think about it too, I just said it.  I‚Äôm literally so grateful that she later said that it was ‚Äútoo hard‚Äù to count but I still cringe when I think about it to this day. That was by far the most ‚Äúpro‚Äù thing I‚Äôve ever done
My recovered A/N friend told my coach that I wasn‚Äôt eating and I‚Äôm almost positive this kind of situation is going to happen to me tomorrow. Good luck <3 hope everything goes good for you.

I feel the same way. That‚Äôs one of the reasons why recovery is so hard. Many of us have forgotten what it‚Äôs like to not struggle with this. We know how bad it is, and how much it sucks, but it‚Äôs at least what we know. We don‚Äôt know what a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù non-disordered life is like, it‚Äôs an unknown, and the fear of the unknown holds us back from recovering and living our true lives. 

I guess sometimes an eating disorder is like self medicating. It‚Äôs an an anesthetic and it‚Äôs hard to lose that. But also, understand that you can‚Äôt let the fear of the unknown hold you back. You deserve to recover. üíï
